ğŸ“„ Ğ”Ğ¾ĞºÑƒĞ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ‚Ñ‹.title: ğŸ“„ Documents
ğŸ“„ Ğ”Ğ¾ĞºÑƒĞ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ‚Ñ‹.content:
â€¢ Required documents for domestic flights:
For flights within Kyrgyzstan, you will need the following documents:
1. Passport of the Kyrgyz Republic or ID card.
2. Flight ticket (electronic or paper).
3. Boarding pass received during check-in.
4. Baggage documents (if checking in baggage).
Visa control rules when crossing the Kyrgyz border are regulated by agreements between the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic and other countries.
The list of countries with visa or visa-free regimes can be found on the official website of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Kyrgyz Republic.
For passenger convenience, a visa point of the Consular Service Department of the MFA KR operates 24/7 at Manas Airport.
Free consultation is provided:
+996 (550) 770 433 (duty consul, 24/7)
For complete and reliable information about visa and consular support in the Kyrgyz Republic, please visit: http://www.mfa.gov.kg

ğŸ›« Ğ ĞµĞ³Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ñ.title: ğŸ›« Check-in
ğŸ›« Ğ ĞµĞ³Ğ¸ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ñ.content:
â€¢ Check-in for the flight:
Passengers must arrive at the airport for ticket check-in and baggage handling:
For international flights â€“ 3 hours before departure
For CIS and domestic flights â€“ 2 hours before departure
FlyDubai and Turkish Airlines check-in ends 1 hour before departure, for others â€“ 40 minutes before
At the airport:
For a comfortable and safe journey, follow these tips while at the airport:
1. Prepare in advance: Check your documents, passport, and ticket to avoid delays. Have hand luggage ready and make sure it meets airline requirements.
2. Arrive on time: Itâ€™s recommended to come to the airport 2â€“3 hours in advance for check-in and security.
3. Follow security rules: Follow staff instructions and present documents. Be patient and cooperative.
4. Responsible consumption: Avoid single-use plastic. Use reusable organizers instead to reduce waste and protect the environment.
5. Keep it clean: Don't litter. Use trash bins and respect public spaces.
6. Baggage handling: Check baggage weight and size to avoid extra charges. Make sure baggage is securely packed.
7. Food and drinks: Bring a reusable water bottle. Many airports have fountains for refills.
8. Comfort: Find a place to rest. Use airport Wi-Fi, shops, and restaurants to pass time pleasantly.
By following these tips, you'll enjoy a smoother and more eco-friendly journey. Have a pleasant flight!

ğŸ›„ Ğ‘Ğ°Ğ³Ğ°Ğ¶.title: ğŸ›„ Baggage
ğŸ›„ Ğ‘Ğ°Ğ³Ğ°Ğ¶.content:
â€¢ Baggage transport rules:
In general, dangerous items are prohibited on board. This includes weapons, ammunition, explosives, flammable liquids, pressurized gases, toxic/radioactive substances, and chemicals.
â€¢ Additional restrictions at Manas Airport:
Items that may be used for attacks or sabotage, and liquids over 100ml (except medicine/baby food in clear plastic bags) are not allowed.
Weapons, including hunting/sports weapons, require special permissions and coordination with airlines and airport security.
â€¢ Weight and size rules:
Airlines set baggage and hand luggage limits based on class and destination:
Economy â€“ 20 kg
Business â€“ 30 kg
First class â€“ 40 kg
Hand luggage â€“ max 5 kg, no more than 55Ã—40Ã—20 cm. One item up to 10 kg can be carried in cabin within the baggage allowance.
Manas follows international standards.
â€¢ Permitted hand luggage items:
- Handbag/briefcase/document folder
- Plastic bag
- Flowers
- Laptop, camera, video camera
- Reading material
- Baby food and infant basket
- Umbrella, cane
- Coat or jacket
- Blanket
- Binoculars
- Foldable wheelchair/crutches if needed
- Medical necessities
- Duty Free purchases within airline rules
â€¢ Special routes:
Some routes allow higher baggage weight. Always check in advance. Total bag size must not exceed:
158 cm â€“ Economy
203 cm â€“ Business/First
Excess baggage is charged based on current airline tariffs at the time of payment.
â€¢ Important:
Free allowance does NOT apply to musical instruments (they need a separate ticket) and animals. Excess baggage must be paid separately. The passenger is responsible for unchecked items. A baggage tag confirms registration. Airlines may reject improperly packed baggage.
Some items (wheelchairs, battery-powered devices, pets, large items) require airline approval in advance.
Luggage must be securely closed to avoid opening mid-flight. Always compare baggage tag and suitcase number on arrival to avoid confusion.
http://www.airport.kg/images/content/bagaj-full.jpg - dangerous goods in passenger luggage

ğŸ¾ ĞŸĞµÑ€ĞµĞ²Ğ¾Ğ·ĞºĞ° Ğ¶Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ….title: ğŸ¾ Pet Transport
ğŸ¾ ĞŸĞµÑ€ĞµĞ²Ğ¾Ğ·ĞºĞ° Ğ¶Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ½Ñ‹Ñ….content:
â€¢ General requirements:
Animals and birds are accepted only with prior approval from the airline and are transported in the cargo hold.
Passengers must notify the airline of the number of animals/birds at the time of booking.
For transport, passengers must provide a veterinary certificate from a competent authority and other required documents from the destination country.
Animals/birds must be in sturdy containers with airflow and secure locks. The container floor must be waterproof and absorbent. Bird cages must be covered with opaque cloth.
The passenger bears responsibility for all airline regulations and will cover damages or additional costs caused by the pet.

ğŸ’ Ğ£Ñ‚ĞµÑ€Ñ Ğ±Ğ°Ğ³Ğ°Ğ¶Ğ°.title: ğŸ’ Lost Baggage
ğŸ’ Ğ£Ñ‚ĞµÑ€Ñ Ğ±Ğ°Ğ³Ğ°Ğ¶Ğ°.content:
â€¢ What to do?
If your baggage is lost during the flight, immediately contact the airline's Lost & Found service at the arrival airport. Present your documents, baggage tag, and describe the contents. Provide contact info. You'll be given a tracking number to follow the status. If itâ€™s not found in a few days, you may need to provide more info and apply for compensation.
Stay calm and keep in touch with the airline. According to international rules, airlines are responsible for lost baggage and must compensate your losses.

Order a car at the Manas Airport Taxi office on the 1st floor (west wing) or in the city. Calls are processed by Dispatch.
Rates:
From Bishkek to Manas Airport â€“ 800 KGS
From Manas to downtown â€“ 800 KGS; to suburbs â€“ 900â€“1100 KGS

Minibus #380 runs between Manas and Bishkek. Stops at the west exit. Final stop: â€œBeyshenalievaâ€ (Chui Ave + Molodaya Gvardiya Blvd) with transfers available. Cost: 60 KGS. Duration: 40â€“60 min. Schedule: 06:40â€“21:00. Every 15 mins.

- Cash: 140 KGS

ğŸŒ± Ğ£Ğ³Ğ»ĞµÑ€Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ ÑĞ»ĞµĞ´.title: ğŸŒ± Carbon Footprint
ğŸŒ± Ğ£Ğ³Ğ»ĞµÑ€Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ ÑĞ»ĞµĞ´.content:
â€¢ A carbon footprint is the amount of CO2 and other greenhouse gases emitted due to human activity, including flights. Air travel significantly contributes to emissions because airplanes burn a lot of fuel, producing CO2 and other gases. This leads to global warming, climate change, and air pollution, harming both nature and human health.
â€¢ To reduce your travel-related footprint, consider direct flights â€” layovers increase emissions. Pack light â€” less weight = less fuel burned. Use reusable storage instead of plastic.
â€¢ Choose electronic tickets and boarding passes to save paper. For airport transfers, use public transport or carpooling. You can also offset emissions by supporting reforestation or clean energy projects. Separate trash and keep airports clean.
â€¢ By following these tips, youâ€™ll minimize your environmental impact and help fight climate change. Reducing emissions is everyone's responsibility â€” small changes lead to big results.
